thread.title: In ‘Warlight,’ Echoes of Ondaatje’s ‘The English Patient’

author: Caryn James
title: In ‘Warlight,’ Echoes of Ondaatje’s ‘The English Patient’
text:
Michael Ondaatje’s “Warlight” was inspired by an idea that became the novel’s first line: “In 1945 our parents went away and left us in the care of two men who may have been criminals.”
His books usually are prompted by “a specific clue I have to unravel,” Mr. Ondaatje says. For “The English Patient,” which won the Booker Prize in 1992 and was adapted into an Oscar-winning movie, “it was a man in a bed talking to a nurse.”
